vignette.name: Remotely opening view panel
vignette.p: Jamoma model's views can embed a subpatcher. This can be useful if you want to keep only basic parameters access in your main view GUI and offer an additionnal panel for advanced parameters settings (see the input~.model's view for example). Using j.ui in your model's view, user can bring the secondary view by clicking the (+) icon in the view top bar.

However, there may be cases where you may want to remotely access this secondary panel view (ie. using a Midi controller pad to open your view panel). To do so, we need to register your model's view in Jamoma namespace so it can be remotely accessed just like any regular Jamoma model.

ul.li: In your unlocked patcher, instantiate your view as a bpatcher
Select the bpatcher then bring its inspector.
Set as first argument to the bpatcher the name of the model you want your view to bind to (ie. /my_input_model~)
Set as second argument a name your view will be registered under in Jamoma namespace (ie. /my_input_view)

vignette.p: When done, you will be able to remotely access your view. In our case here, you may use j.send to open the secondary panel or use Jamoma mapper.model to map note in messages to /my_input_view/ui:panel destination address.
